page.title: 13Arable Farm 2:The Deverills
page.content: There are four peak periods in the farming year at{Woodcombe Farm.}In the autumn the farmer ploughs and sows the winter wheat, in the winter he sows the spring barley. Early summer is busy with silage-making, a first and usually a second cut, and the busiest time of all, harvest-time. Throughout the year the farmer top dresses the crops and grass ley with nitrogen. Woodcombe Farm is an old farmhouse, built around 175O, with large modern barns and the most up-to-date farming equipment. The farm is very mechanised with four tractors, and all its own equipment, from combine-harvester to silage trailers.Twenty years ago the farm grew 80-100 acres of corn, the acreage of cereals has increased ,and also the yield per acre due to the greater use of chemicals to control weeds and fertilise crops.
